snippet: President Obama on Friday emphasized the last three months of job creation while Mitt Romney argued that Mr. Obama has been a failed economic steward.
abstract: White House and Republicans each issue statements attempting to capture political advantage from the March jobs report, which showed lower-than-expected payroll numbers; Obama administration predictably states that numbers reflect effective recovery policies, as Mitt Romney cites them as evidence of Obama's failed economic stewardship.
lead_paragraph: President Obama on Friday emphasized the last three months of job creation while Mitt Romney argued that Mr. Obama has been a failed economic steward.

headline.seo: In a Mixed Jobs Report, Ammunition for All Sides on the Economy
headline.main: On Jobs, Obama and Romney Argue Over Fullness of the Glass
headline.print_headline: In a Mixed Jobs Report, Ammunition for All Sides on the Economy: As Obama Praises Data, Romney Deplores It
